description: A small, beautiful lovebird with a green body, golden-yellow neck, and a fiery orange-red face. A prominent white eye-ring gives them a distinct look.
temperament: Playful, charming, and social. They are known for being slightly less aggressive and territorial than Peach-faced Lovebirds, but still have big personalities.
loudness: Loud. They have a very high-pitched, shrill call that can be quite piercing.
vocalization: Not known to mimic speech. Their main vocalization is their loud, natural call.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of small pellets, fresh vegetables, and a small amount of fruit is ideal. They enjoy a variety of greens.
healthPointers: Can live 15-20 years. Prone to eye infections if their environment isn't clean. Also susceptible to psittacosis and common avian bacterial infections.
housing: Their loud call makes them a potential issue for apartments. They need a secure cage with small bar spacing. Minimum 20"W x 20"D x 24"H.
